name: staarpipelinesummary_varset_v0.9.6
title: Summarizing Results from STAAR Pipeline for Analyzing WGS/WES Data
summary: This is a pipeline applet to summarize results from STAAR procedure for analyzing whole-genome/whole-exome sequencing data. For more details about this applet, please see the user manual at https://tinyurl.com/staarpipeline
description: For all summary and conditional analyses, an instance type of "mem2_ssd1_v2_x32" is recommended.

inputSpec.name: outfile
inputSpec.label: Output file prefix
inputSpec.help: Prefix of output file name. The output result files will be multiple .Rdata and .csv objects.

inputSpec.name: infiles
inputSpec.label: Input array results
inputSpec.help: Input results for summary and conditional analysis, must be result files from the staarpipeline applet.

inputSpec.name: infile_prefix
inputSpec.label: Prefix of input results
inputSpec.help: Prefix of input results (without chromosome number). For example, when summarizing single variant test results of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL): LDL_single_chr1, LDL_single_chr2,..., LDL_single_chr22, prefix should be "LDL_single_chr".

inputSpec.name: known_varlist_rsID
inputSpec.label: Known variant list (rsID)
inputSpec.help: A comma separated values (.csv) file (first row is the header) saving the known variant list in rsID format to be adjusted for in conditional analysis. The file must include a column named "SNPS" for the list of rsIDs of the known variants. In addition, it could also include a column named "CHR" as the chromosome number of each SNP (row) for faster retrieval.

inputSpec.name: known_varlist_4columns
inputSpec.label: Known variant list (4 columns)
inputSpec.help: A comma separated values (.csv) file (first row is the header) saving the known variant list in 4 columns format to be adjusted for in conditional analysis. The file must include 4 columns with the following names: "CHR" (chromosome number), "POS" (position), "REF" (reference allele), and "ALT" (alternative allele).

inputSpec.name: nullobj_file
inputSpec.label: Null model
inputSpec.help: An R object saving the fitted null mixed model from STAAR. Must be an .RData or .Rda file.

inputSpec.name: agds_files
inputSpec.label: AGDS files
inputSpec.help: Genotype and functional annotation all-in-one GDS (AGDS) files for all chromosomes (1-22) in .gds format. Must be provided if performing conditional analysis.

inputSpec.name: agds_file_name
inputSpec.label: Name of AGDS files
inputSpec.help: Name of AGDS files (without chromosome number). For example, when performing conditional analysis using AGDS files "chr1_agds.gds",..., "chr22_agds.gds", the name should be "chr_agds".

inputSpec.name: annotation_name_catalog_file
inputSpec.label: Annotation name catalog
inputSpec.help: A comma separated values (.csv) file containing the name ("name") and the corresponding channel name ("dir") in the AGDS files. If the AGDS files are generated using FAVORannotator, the .csv file can be downloaded from https://github.com/xihaoli/STAARpipeline-Tutorial/tree/main/FAVORannotator_csv/annotation_name_catalog.csv. Must be provided if performing conditional analysis.

inputSpec.name: max_maf
inputSpec.label: Maximum minor allele frequency for a variant to be included in variant-set test ("Gene_Centric_Coding", "Gene_Centric_Noncoding", "ncRNA", "Sliding_Window")
inputSpec.help: Note this is the maximum minor allele frequency, not the alternate (coding) allele frequency. If not specified, 0.01 will be used as the default (to perform variant-set analysis for rare variants).

inputSpec.name: use_stepwise_selection
inputSpec.label: Use stepwise selection for variants in known_varlist_rsID and known_varlist_4columns or not
inputSpec.help: Whether to perform stepwise selection for variants in known_varlist_rsID and known_varlist_4columns. Either "YES" or "NO". If not specified, "YES" will be used as the default.

inputSpec.name: min_maf_adj
inputSpec.label: Minimum minor allele frequency for a variant to be adjusted for in conditional analysis
inputSpec.help: Note this is the minimum minor allele frequency, not the alternate (coding) allele frequency. If not specified, 0.01 will be used as the default (to only adjust for common and low-frequency variants in conditional analysis).

inputSpec.name: qc_label_dir
inputSpec.label: Channel name of the QC label in the AGDS file
inputSpec.help: Channel name of the QC label in the AGDS file, where PASS variants should be labeled as "PASS". If not specified, "annotation/filter" will be used as the default.

inputSpec.name: variant_type
inputSpec.label: Type of variant included in the conditional analysis
inputSpec.help: Type of variant included in the conditional analysis. Choices include "SNV", "Indel", or "variant". If not specified, "SNV" will be used as the default.

inputSpec.name: geno_missing_imputation
inputSpec.label: Method of handling missing genotypes
inputSpec.help: Method of handling missing genotypes. Either "mean" or "minor". If not specified, "mean" will be used as the default.

inputSpec.name: annotation_dir
inputSpec.label: Channel name of the annotations in the AGDS file
inputSpec.help: Channel name of the annotations in the AGDS file. If not specified, "annotation/info/FunctionalAnnotation" will be used as the default, which is consistent with FAVORannotator.

inputSpec.name: use_annotation_weights
inputSpec.label: Use annotations as weights or not
inputSpec.help: Use annotations as weights or not. Either "YES" or "NO". If not specified, "YES" will be used as the default.

inputSpec.name: annotation_name
inputSpec.label: Annotations used in STAAR (multiple annotations should be comma-separated, with no space, like "aPC.Conservation,aPC.Protein")
inputSpec.help: Annotations used in STAAR. Should be a subset of annotations in the annotation_name_catalog_file (if multiple annotations, they should be comma-separated, with no space, like "aPC.Conservation,aPC.Protein"). If not specified, "CADD,LINSIGHT,FATHMM.XF,aPC.EpigeneticActive,aPC.EpigeneticRepressed,aPC.EpigeneticTranscription,aPC.Conservation,aPC.LocalDiversity,aPC.Mappability,aPC.TF,aPC.Protein" will be used as the default, which is consistent with FAVORannotator.
